Subject: Re: Activation functions and data types
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=561746680; y=7dZpr6o-HtGHolDWKYYXXAbItmUhUKU9xnwe38OZ-s4BIN5rvhA
X-Yahoo-Profile: lordalveric

------=_Part_473808_2014550383.1454842176771
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

If you really want to optimize for speed, you could even use a lookup table=
, perhaps with some interpolation. Back in my Forth days, we typically did =
everything in Integer, just shifting the decimal point with the math. One c=
ould do similar with the activation functions, along with the lookup tables=
.
But I would imagine that in most cases, the evaluation will be quite a bi=
t more compute intensive than computing the activation. One might consider =
using "regular" math for the evolution phase, but then using lookup tables =
to speed up the activation of your final result.

Kind Regards,

Fred Mitch=
ell,=C2=A0


+49 (0)17 480 98973, Skype: flajann
